title: How to start DSA as a complete beginner in 3rd sem?
content: I am about to start 3rd sem, i know java and cpp and just the very basics of data structures like lists, stacks, queue etc(basic as in just definitions)...how should i start learning DSA? Should i buy some course from udemy or cousera? I initially started with Striver A2Z DSA sheet but idk if its completely beginner friendly and will take from basics to advanced level.

comments.body: Start coding on Leetcode while following Neetcode.
Hasn't 3rd Semester start for u all, already ...

Neetcode (a popular YouTube channel) has tons of videos on leetcode problems. You could watch that.

But if you want to learn in a more systematic manner , I suggest you go to neetcode.io website , in that , go to roadmap , there you have everything mapped out very very well. You can start from there. You'll figure it out how to start yourself.

Wish someone taught me this when I was in my 3rd year.
I am currently doing the AI tutor led DSA course in edmigo.in. The doubt solving feature helps for a beginner like me.
interesting. what field do you think should a fresher focus on, web dev or dsa or anything else? im more interested in freelancing so i can cover my expenses while aalso studying

DSA is something you can't skip. No matter what company or job role you apply to , it could be frontend development , backend development, data science jobs , devops job , anything , you'll need DSA because every company shortlists students based on DSA (which is always the first round in an interview).

As for freelancing , web development is super helpful. If you learn full stack (both front end and backend) , you can take small projects on sites like fiverr
